author: Connor Makar
description:
Another PlayStation State of Play took place tonight, giving as a peak at what's to come on the PS5 and PS5 Pro. The event was stacked with new trailers, including some reveals of entirely new games we've not seen before. Sony even remembered the PS VR2 exists!

Read more
title: PlayStation State of Play June 2025: Everything announced

author: Victoria Phillips Kennedy
description:
Those keen to hear more about Sucker Punch's Ghost of Yōtei will be able to tune in for a gameplay deep dive next month.

Read more
title: Ghost of Yōtei deep dive coming next month, but can we pet the dog?

author: Matt Wales
description:
Guilty Gear developer Arc System Works has unveiled new tag team fighter Marvel Tōkon: Fighting Souls, which is bringing 4v4 superheroic battling to PS5 and PC later this year.

Read more
title: Marvel Tōkon: Fighting Souls is a superhero tag team fighter launching next year

author: Ed Nightingale
description:
Sony has announced more games coming to the PS Plus catalogue this summer, including classics and day one releases.

Read more
title: Here are more PS Plus games coming this summer

author: Victoria Phillips Kennedy
description:
You know the name, you know the number. Yes, it is James Bond 007, but like we have never seen him before.

Read more
title: Here's our first look at a fresh-faced, whipper snapper of a James Bond in 007: First Light

author: Matt Wales
description:
Beloved first-person stealth series Thief is being resurrected for a new instalment on PlayStation VR2. It's called Thief VR: Legacy of Shadow and it's out later this year.

Read more
title: After more than a decade, classic stealth series Thief is being revived for PSVR2

author: Ed Nightingale
description:
A new Nioh game was announced at tonight's PlayStation State of Play and there's a demo out right now.

Read more
title: Nioh 3 announced and there's a demo out now

author: Victoria Phillips Kennedy
description:
Silent Hill f has landed itself a release date, and got itself a new trailer to go with it.

Read more
title: Silent Hill f will be "more action-oriented" than Silent Hill 2 remake, coming September

author: Ed Nightingale
description:
Suda 51 has revealed his next game with studio Grasshopper: Romeo is a Dead Man.

Read more
title: Suda 51's next game is the ultra-violent Romeo is a Dead Man

author: Ed Nightingale
description:
The long-rumoured remaster of Final Fantasy Tactics is real and was finally revealed at tonight's PlayStation State of Play.

Read more
title: Long-rumoured Final Fantasy Tactics remaster is real

author: Matt Wales
description:
Legendary game designer Tetsuya Mizuguchi - the man responsible for the likes of Rez, Space Channel 5, and Tetris Effect - is reviving his much-loved musical block-dropper series Lumines and it's coming to PS5 and PSVR2 later this year.

Read more
title: Classic musical block-dropper Lumines is getting a brand-new entry later this year

author: Victoria Phillips Kennedy
description:
Pragmata - Capcom's long in the pipeline astronaut and small girl-starring game - has had its release window narrowed down once again.

Read more
title: Capcom's Pragmata coming 2026, developer promises

author: Matt Wales
description:
Switch 2 is finally getting into the public's hands, meaning answers for all sorts of previously unanswered questions are beginning to emerge as the system gets a thorough go-over. And, if you were wondering, it looks like one of the original Switch's most exasperating features - its horribly sluggish eShop experience - has now been resolved with the new console.

Read more
title: It looks like Switch 2's finally fixed its predecessor's painfully sluggish eShop

author: Matt Wales
description:
Switch 2 is almost upon us (and in some territories, actually upon us), and with its arrival comes Nintendo's much-touted day one update. We already knew it was an important one, unlocking a significant amount of the console's basic functionality, but Nintendo's patch notes make it clear you won't be doing much of anything right out of the box on launch day without it.

Read more
title: Here's everything Switch 2 won't be able to do without installing its day one update

author: Matt Wales
description:
Subnautica 2 might still be lacking an early access release date beyond a vague "2025" window, but that hasn't stopped Unknown Worlds from cranking the hype handling a little harder, with the studio having now shared a few additional details as part of a new video Q&A.

Read more
title: Subnautica 2 studio talks silent protagonist, a big ol' ocean map, and more in latest Q&A

author: Alex Donaldson
description:
It's that most thrilling time, the dawn of a new hardware generation. It's gaming Christmas! As a critic, that means it's time for that finest tradition - an intense period of bedding in with a new piece of hardware, vigorously road-testing it so that we can inform you, our delightful readers, if this thrilling new piece of tech is worth your money.

Read more
title: A completely timely review of Nintendo's controversial, expensive handheld

author: Robert Purchese
description:
The not-E3 week is about to begin as Sony readies a PlayStation State of Play broadcast for 10pm UK time (11pm CEST / 2pm PT / 5pm ET) tonight. We'll cover the broadcast live right here, reporting the major talking points in case you're out walking the dog or stuck somewhere else, and you can also - hi regulars! - assemble in the comments to watch along and chat with us.

Read more
title: PlayStation State of Play June 2025 live stream and blog - Bloodborne remake time?

author: Connor Makar
description:
Epic Games has confirmed that Fortnite is upgraded on the Nintendo Switch 2 to include 60FPS support, higher resolution graphics, greater view distances and more. This will be available from tomorow, 5th June - the same day the Switch 2 launches.

Read more
title: Fortnite runs at 60FPS on the Nintendo Switch 2, supports game chat and mouse controls

author: Connor Makar
description:
Balatro dev Localthunk has revealed a lovely little reference hidden inside one of the game's many cards, one that calls back to his home town of Regina, Saskatchewan.

Read more
title: Balatro creator reveals a little taste of home hidden in one of the game's many cards

author: Connor Makar
description:
Dune Awakening has surpassed Elden Ring Nightreign on Steam's Top Sellers chart, one day before its early launch for Deluxe and Ultimate Edition owners. Only Counter Strike 2 seems able to keep the Survival MMO at bay.

Read more
title: Dune Awakening surpasses Elden Ring Nightreign on Steam's Top Sellers before it's even out

author: Sherif Saed
description:
The time has come to celebrate the second anniversary of Diablo 4. Yes, the game has been out for two years now, even if it does not feel like it's been that long. And with every anniversary, of course, comes a new event from Blizzard designed to commemorate it.

Read more
title: Diablo 4's Anniversary Celebration event won't be one to remember for its rewards, but at least you won't have to pay real money for it

author: Richard Leadbetter
description:
AMD is looking to disrupt the mainstream GPU market with its RX 9060 XT in the same way that its xx70 class products caused so many problems for Nvidia's RTX 5070 and RTX 5070 Ti. The formula is remarkably straightforward: attack the entry-level RTX 5060 by offering a similarly 8GB-equipped product with a lot more performance for the same price: $299. Meanwhile, AMD's ambitions for its 16GB alternative are laudable. It may not be as fast as the RTX 5060 Ti, but it's not that far off and it costs a whole lot less: $350 vs $430. In the UK, the RX 9060 XT prices are different, of course, with suggested retail prices of £270 for the 8GB model and £315 for the 16GB card.

Read more
title: AMD Radeon RX 9060 XT 16GB review: a potent challenger to RTX 5060 Ti

author: Matt Wales
description:
No Man's Sky is boldly going where no nine-year-old exploratory space sim has gone before: Switch 2. Developer Hello Games has announced a free launch-day update that'll bring significant upgrades compared to the original Switch release, including enhanced visuals, multiplayer, and more. That's in addition to a major update for all platforms arriving today.

Read more
title: No Man's Sky getting a free Switch 2 launch day update adding fancier visuals, multiplayer, and more

author: Ed Nightingale
description:
RuneScape developer Jagex has confirmed it's paused Project Zanaris, which aimed to add community servers to Old School RuneScape.

Read more
title: RuneScape developer Jagex shook by layoffs, while Old School Runescape project put on pause

author: Victoria Phillips Kennedy
description:
Gather your ghost hunting crew, but this time rather than grabbing your torches and crucifixes, reach out for some popcorn instead - a film adaptation of Phasmophobia is on its way.

Read more
title: Phasmophobia has earned itself a movie adaptation from M3gan and Five Nights at Freddy's production company, Blumhouse

author: Chris Tapsell
description:
I normally hate talking about video games in terms of how much money they're worth, but with Welcome Tour - and against the backdrop of video games' wider squeeze on its audience - that discussion feels unavoidable. To get it out of the way: Welcome Tour feels like a pack-in game, and after the news broke that it would, instead, cost you actual money to play this seemingly staid, interactive console manual - one that seemed pretty similar to the free, pack-in Astro's Playroom on PS5 - there was a very understandable reaction. That being: this game is probably not going to do very well.

Read more</
title: Welcome Tour is the Switch 2's welcome surprise, and might even be worth your 8 quid

author: Victoria Phillips Kennedy
description:
Mario Kart World won't include a 200cc mode for faster racing, but producer Kosuke Yabuki hasn't ruled it out for a post-launch addition.

Read more
title: Mario Kart World doesn't have a 200cc mode, but producer not ruling it out for down the road

author: Victoria Phillips Kennedy
description:
Nintendo is currently in full swing gearing up for the launch of Switch 2, and part of that has seen the company update a number of its original Switch games for the newer model. While many of these updates are along the lines of 'added support', Nintendo has gone a bit further with Legend of Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom - there's finally a more streamlined way to find favourite Echoes no matter which console you play on.

Read more
title: Nintendo belatedly adds much-needed feature to Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom

author: Connor Makar
description:
The director of Elden Ring Nightreign has claimed he was able to beat the game solo and without relics, that it's very possible to do so, and wants players to have the confidence to try it themselves.

Read more
title: Elden Ring Nightreign director claims to have beaten everything solo and without relics, but can he do it with a saxophone?
